subTopics.title: General principles of cancer chemotherapy and drug resistance

quizzes.question: What is the main difference in cell elimination between first-order kinetics and alternative kinetics during chemotherapy?
quizzes.goodAnswer: First-order kinetics kill a constant percentage of cells.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: First-order kinetics kill a constant number of cells.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Alternative kinetics kill a constant percentage of cells.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: First-order kinetics depend on the tumor type for effective killing.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Alternative kinetics show no pattern in cell killing.

quizzes.question: Why is combination chemotherapy often more effective than single-drug therapy?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Combines drugs with different mechanisms and dose-limiting toxicities.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Reduces overall side effects of the treatment.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Increases the therapeutic index of each drug.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Allows using drugs in non-therapeutic environments.

quizzes.question: What is the main mechanism of corticosteroids in treating lymphoid malignancies?
How does L-asparaginase function differently in cancerous lymphoblasts compared to normal cells?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Lymphoblasts die without asparagine due to lack of asparagine synthetase.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: L-asparaginase reduces lysine levels in lymphoblasts.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Normal cells overproduce asparagine synthase in response.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Lymphoblasts convert L-asparaginase to aspartate independently.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Normal cells DNA is resistant to L-asparaginase.

quizzes.question: Which chemotherapeutic agent toxicity is associated with acute renal failure due to high doses?
What unique toxicity is associated with the use of Cyclophosphamide?
What is a key requirement for combination chemotherapy in terms of drug mechanisms?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Drugs must have different mechanisms of action.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Drugs must share a common metabolic pathway.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: All drugs must target the same cellular structure.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Drugs should be derived from similar chemical families.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Drugs must have identical dose-limiting toxicities.

quizzes.question: What is the critical benefit of using combination chemotherapy in acute lymphocytic leukemia treatment?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Decreases the chance of drug-resistant clone emergence.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Allows the use of lower drug doses.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Eliminates the need for follow-up treatments.

quizzes.question: What mechanism leads to the emergence of acquired drug resistance in tumor cells?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Genotypic and phenotypic changes during therapy.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Enhanced tumor cell apoptosis from drugs.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Increased oxidative stress on normal cells.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Rapid depletion of tumor vascular supply.

quizzes.question: How does the P-glycoprotein contribute to multidrug resistance?
quizzes.goodAnswer: It increases drug efflux out of the cell.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: It enhances drug binding to DNA.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: It blocks drug entry into the nucleus.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It stimulates drug metabolism within the cytoplasm.
